speaker: Daphne
text: Explain to me again how you and Mel masquerading as husband and wife is a good thing?

speaker: Niles
text: Well...

speaker: Frasier
text: If I may?  Uh, Daphne, it's basically to give Mel a little wiggle room so she can get out of this debacle with her dignity intact.

speaker: Daphne
text: And what about Niles' dignity?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Maris got that in the divorce. [_laughing_] Sorry, Niles. [_rising_] Would you like some sherry?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, yes, thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rising_] Yeah, all right, I'll get your precious wedge of brie and your water crackers.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I meant would you like some sherry?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_stunned_] Oh, love some, thanks.  [_She sits back down._]

speaker: Niles
text: Listen, Daphne, I know this is all very awkward, but if it speeds up the divorce process and avoids the misery I went through with Maris, isn't it worth it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, come on, Schnookums, we can get through this together. What do you say?

speaker: Daphne
text: What did you just call me?

speaker: Niles
text: Schnookums.

speaker: Daphne
text: Schnookums...

speaker: Niles
text: It was an attempt at a pet name.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, if it's all the same to you, can we keep looking?

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely, there's no rush whatsoever... Truffles. [_an awkward pause_] It's the chocolate, not the fungus. [_another pause_] It's a work in progress.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: For you... here it is: To better days.  For all of us.

speaker: Daphne
text: Why, what happened to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I went down to talk to Donny, try to convince him to drop his lawsuit against you.  Instead, he's now suing me as well for the part I played in getting you two together.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I am so sorry, Dr. Crane.  This is turning into such a horrible mess!  Not that I expected it to be a bed of roses, mind you, but it's gotten so you're wonder what God-awful calamity's going to befall us all next.

speaker: Simon
text: Something smells in your elevator.   Oh, now it smells in here, too.  I'm beginning to think this is not such a ritzy building after all.

speaker: Daphne
text: Did you get my wedding gifts down to the post?

speaker: Simon
text: As we speak, they are winging their way towards their rightful owners.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you, Simon.

speaker: Simon
text: And in a totally unrelated matter, I am pleased to announce that the Winnebago is now fully equipped with a state of the art DVD, complete with surround sound.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't believe this!

speaker: Simon
text: Tonight's feature is "Braveheart", starring Australia's favorite son, Mr. Mel Gibson.  Showtime is at eight sharp, everyone is invited.

speaker: Daphne
text: As tempting as that sounds, I have a date.  Niles is taking me to dinner and dancing.  At least this day will end on a high note.

speaker: Niles
text: I guess I can't avoid telling you this any longer...

speaker: Martin
text: I just want you to know, I'm attending this wedding reception under protest.

speaker: Daphne
text: Wedding reception?

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks, Dad.  Yeah, well, you know those social obligations I was talking about?  One of them is tonight.

speaker: Daphne
text: A wedding reception?  For you and Mel?

speaker: Niles
text: It's at the equestrian center.  It's nothing major, it's very impromptu.  Champagne, cake, we pet the horses, we're out of there by eleven!

speaker: Daphne
text: But what about our...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, Niles, look at the time.  I'm sorry Daphne, but we've got to get cross town in an hour.  You better get home and get changed.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't forget to wear that watch Mel gave you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Watch?

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks again, Dad!  I can explain that.  I, I can explain everything.  Tomorrow.  It's just a twenty-four hour delay. [_He heads for the door._] I switched all the reservations. Dining, dancing, everything.  I promise I will make it up to you... pookie. [_pause_] Even I hate that one.

speaker: Daphne
text: But what about our date? _She sits on the couch and begins to cry.  Simon goes over to comfort her._

speaker: Simon
text: Now, now, now, Daphne.  Don't cry, don't cry.  It's all right. This sounds like a job for Braveheart.   **MUCKING ABOUT WITH THE HORSEY SET**  _Scene 2 - The Equestrian Center Fade in.  Frasier and Martin are standing at the bar in the club area._

speaker: Martin
text: Don't look now, but there's a guy over there in a bow tie who's been checking me out for the last twenty minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, one of Mel's colleagues.  I met him earlier.

speaker: Martin
text: What's he keep staring at me for?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he's a plastic surgeon.  Maybe he's looking at your eyelids and planning his next trip to Maui.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord!  Look at him, over-acting.  Trying to convince everyone he's happily married.  Have you ever seen anything so pathetic in your life?

speaker: Martin
text: How 'bout you and Lilith?

speaker: Frasier
text: It was a rhetorical question!

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Mel
text: Niles, I'd, I'd like you to meet Adrianna Pettibone.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Mel
text: Adrianna stables General Prescott, our current grand champion right here at the Equestrian Club.

speaker: Niles
text: Wonderful!  Speaking of grand champions, how about this little filly, hmm?  I didn't even have to check her teeth!

speaker: Mel
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, I'm a little nervous.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'm here.  Congratulations and all that BS, where's the bar?

speaker: Niles
text: Roz, what are you doing here?

speaker: Mel
text: I invited her.  Your side of the guest list looked a little sparse.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, forgive me if I'm not in the spirit of this - wink, wink -- "happy occasion," but I'm in a very crappy mood.

speaker: Niles
text: Are you limping?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.  I twisted my ankle on the stairs.  You know how that happened?  I couldn't find the shoes that went with this dress, so I had to wear these stupid three inch spikes.  And the "check engine" light on my dash keeps coming on.

speaker: Niles
text: What does that have to do with your ankle?

speaker: Roz
text: Nothing, it just really ticks me off!  The bar, the bar! [_Niles and Mel both point._] Thank you!

speaker: Niles
text: That was so sweet of her to come.

speaker: Mel
text: Niles, this is important.  If anyone should ask about the honeymoon, we're flying to Paris, then we're taking the Orient Express to Venice, where we'll spend two weeks at the Monsarta Palazzetto suite at the Cipriani.

speaker: Mel
text: What's the matter?

speaker: Niles
text: Sounds like a wonderful trip.

speaker: Mel
text: It's not my fault we're not going.

speaker: Niles
text: I know.

speaker: Photographer
text: Ah, here's the happy couple.  All right, you two, show me those pearly whites.

speaker: Photographer
text: All right, now how 'bout a kiss?

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I hardly know you, but...  _He takes a step towards the photographer with a laugh, Mel puts her hand on his arm._

speaker: Niles
text: Here we go.

speaker: Photographer
text: Come on, Doc, this is your wife, not mine.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, well...  _He puts his arms around her and they kiss.  Everyone makes an "Aww" sound and claps._

speaker: Mel
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I'll, uh, I'll go check on Dad and Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, they do make a lovely couple.

speaker: Woman
text: Don't they?  I'm sure they'll be happy together for many years.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you never know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you don't, do you?  I mean, I'm just saying you never know.

speaker: Woman
text: No, I... guess you don't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely talking with you.  Enjoy the party.

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell's wrong with you?

speaker: Martin
text: In a few weeks, I'm gonna look like a genius.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I really feel stupid.  I just came on to the guy in the tux.  They really should make waiters wear name tags.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, Roz.  Carrying trays and taking drink orders leaves so much room for ambiguity.

speaker: Roz
text: Shut up!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, well, I think it's going pretty well.  Don't you? You think anyone's suspicious?

speaker: Martin
text: No, no.  It's the greatest phony reception I've ever been to. So, how you holdin' up, son?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, if I have to stretch my muscles into a smile one more time, I think my face may crack...

speaker: Mel
text: Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: [_smiling big_] Yes, Darling!

speaker: Mel
text: It's time to cut the cake, so why don't you just gather everyone around?

speaker: Niles
text: OK.

speaker: Mel
text: All right. [_He moves off, she turns to Martin._] Um, excuse me, I need to borrow Frasier for just one moment.

speaker: Martin
text: Sure.

speaker: Mel
text: Uh, Frasier, I had an interesting little phone call from Donny this afternoon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh?

speaker: Mel
text: Yes, he said you'd been by to see him earlier today.

speaker: Frasier
text: I may have done so.

speaker: Mel
text: Yes, he said you were a busy little bee before the wedding. First buzzing in Niles' ear, and then you were buzzing in Daphne's ear...

speaker: Frasier
text: Let me explain Mel.  You see...

speaker: Mel
text: Buzz, buzz, buzz, buzz, buzz, buzz, buzz...

speaker: Frasier
text: Just stop that, please!

speaker: Mel
text: You see, I've been torturing myself trying to figure out how this all happened so quickly, and now I know.  I won't forget about this.

speaker: Martin
text: What was that all about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Donny talked to Mel.

speaker: Martin
text: Told you not to go down there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just stop that!

speaker: Mel
text: Attention everyone!  Before we cut the cake, Niles' brother, Frasier, would like to make a toast in our honor.

speaker: Martin
text: I didn't know you were doin' this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Neither did I.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, ah...  Love...is an awesome force.  It can make us do things we never imagined possible.  For you see, we don't actually choose love, it chooses us.  And once it has, we are powerless to do anything about it.  Ladies and gentlemen, raise your glasses with me in toasting my brother... and the love of his life.

speaker: Frasier
text: For she is truly the woman of his dreams, and my father and I could not be more thrilled with his choice.  To the happy couple! _Everyone makes "Hear, hear" comments and drinks.  Niles begins cutting the cake._

speaker: Mel
text: Well, wasn't that clever of your brother?  It's only too bad your little English muffin couldn't be here to enjoy it as well.  Which reminds me: you do realize that while we are pretending to be married, you absolutely cannot be seen in public with Daphne?

speaker: Mel
text: I love you too, honey!   _End of Act 3  Act 4_ **ACTUALLY A GOAT GOT MOST OF THE HOT DOG** _Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Simon comes through the front door._

speaker: Simon
text: Hello?  Hello, is anybody home?

speaker: Martin
text: [_from the kitchen_] Hey, Simon.  Just making coffee, you want some?

speaker: Simon
text: [_lying down on the couch_] Ahh, I was thinking of something colder with a bit more of an amber hue.

speaker: Martin
text: Beer?

speaker: Simon
text: Brilliant! if you aren't the finest detective in Seattle, I am the Prince of Wales.

speaker: Martin
text: How did Eddie like his walk?

speaker: Simon
text: The little nipper loved it.  I think nature's callin' him again.  His bladder's worse than mine.  I'll be back in a flash.  _He leaves.  Martin comes in and sits in his chair as Frasier enters from the bedrooms, putting his tie on._

speaker: Frasier
text: Was that Simon's voice I heard just now?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he just took Eddie on a walk for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's about time that chowder made himself useful.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, don't be so hard on him.  He tries.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, if you're talking about my patience, he certainly does.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Niles, come on in.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.  Oh, hey Dad, about a block from here, I saw a dog that looked remarkably like Eddie tied up outside a bar.

speaker: Martin
text: Impossible, he was just here.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting on the couch_] Oh.  So, uh, did you say anything to her?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, you told us not to.

speaker: Martin
text: You want us out of here when you drop the hammer?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I think I'll be safer with witnesses.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles.  I didn't hear you come in.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rising_] I just got here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey.  _He goes to her.  They lean to kiss each other, but again are uncomfortable with the others watching, so they kiss on the side of the mouth._

speaker: Niles
text: How are you today?

speaker: Daphne
text: Wonderful.  I realize that postponing our date one day doesn't really amount to much in the great scheme of things. So how was your wedding reception?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it was your average night in hell.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that's behind us, now.  We have a wonderful evening to look forward to.  I bought a new dress.  It's much too expensive, but you're worth it.  And I'm getting me hair done and me... [_to Frasier_] Why are you looking at each other like that?

speaker: Frasier
text: We're not looking at each other like that.  Like what?  What, like anything.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh-uh.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes you were.  Those darting little glances mean something's up.  Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: About tonight...

speaker: Daphne
text: I hate the way this is starting.

speaker: Niles
text: Mel feels that as long as she and I are acting to be married, you and I can't be seen together in public.  So that means...

speaker: Daphne
text: I know what that means.

speaker: Niles
text: But it's just until the divorce.

speaker: Daphne
text: Whenever that bloody is.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: If you'll excuse me, I have a splitting headache. _She gets up and heads for her room, Niles following.  Frasier gets up and moves over to the couch to be out of the way._

speaker: Niles
text: You know, if you look at it from Mel's point of view, it really does make a lot of sense.

speaker: Frasier
text: He came so close.

speaker: Daphne
text: What did you say?

speaker: Niles
text: I said "Damn that Mel!"

speaker: Daphne
text: No you didn't.  You should have, but you didn't.  It sounded to me like you were taking her side.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right.  Can we just turn the clock back two minutes and pretend this conversation never happened?

speaker: Daphne
text: Why don't we just it back to ten minutes before my wedding and save everybody all this trouble?

speaker: Niles
text: What are you saying?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_stopping again without turning_] What do you think I'm saying?

speaker: Niles
text: It sounds like you're saying you're sorry you did this.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_turning to him_] Maybe that's what I'm saying.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, boy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now listen, before anyone says something they'll regret...

speaker: Daphne
text: Butt out!  If you hadn't opened your big mouth we wouldn't be in this mess!  Donny wouldn't be suing me and everyone else in sight and I wouldn't be out two weeks salary for a dress I'm apparently never going to wear, [_to Niles_] and you wouldn't be kowtowing to that shrew of a wife of yours!

speaker: Frasier
text: This is all _my_ fault?!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh shut up, Frasier!  The only thing more hollow than your protest of innocence is your big fat head!

speaker: Frasier
text: I AM WOUNDED!  I intervened only out of love for the two people who are most important to...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, put a sock in it! I am sick and tired of listening to you yammering on about everything under the sun!

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: And I'm sick of listening to you, too.  You got anything to say, old man?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Good!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm waiting!

speaker: Niles
text: For what?

speaker: Frasier
text: An apology.  For that unprovoked broadside you leveled at me.

speaker: Niles
text: You expect me to apologize to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Expect it, sir, and demand it!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, then, here's my answer: No!

speaker: Frasier
text: No?!

speaker: Niles
text: [_heading for the door_] No!  And furthermore, why don't you take your broadside, stuff it in a chair, and keep your unlimited supply of opinions, suggestions, proposals and recommendations to yourself?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I never!

speaker: Niles
text: No, you always!

speaker: Frasier
text: GET OUT!

speaker: Martin
text: [_rising_] How's a corned beef sandwich sound?

speaker: Frasier
text: I am appalled!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, no problem, there's some smoked turkey in here, too.  _He goes into the kitchen.  Reset to: the kitchen as he enters.  He goes to the refrigerator and starts pulling things out.  Frasier comes in._

speaker: Frasier
text: What is my offense?  What egregious sin have I committed, that I should be so maligned?  Was I to just sit idly by and watch these two misguided souls embark on doomed relationships?  Would they have thanked me for that?  Not very likely, I dare say.

speaker: Martin
text: Who moved the mustard?

speaker: Frasier
text: Top shelf, door.

speaker: Martin
text: Bingo.

speaker: Frasier
text: And then, when they were perched on the very brink of disaster, I snatched them from the gaping maw and placed them gently into one another's arms.  But am I accorded a hero's welcome for my troubles?  Am I hoisted on their shoulders and paraded about the room?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't have my glasses, what's the expiration date?

speaker: Frasier
text: Last week.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll chance it.

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  Those two ingrates turn on me like vipers, and make me the villain of the piece.  Well, hear me now, this day forward, Frasier Crane will not interfere with those two! This is it!  Finished, finito!  _Non quam postea_! [_N.B. Latin, "never again"_]

speaker: Martin
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know I've made declarations like this before, but I tell you what, Dad, you mark the calendar!  You note the time on your watch! [_points to his own_] This - Is - It!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if you figure out a way to get them back together, I'll be in my room if you need any help.

speaker: Frasier
text: Have you been listening to me?

speaker: Martin
text: [_from the living room_] Well, I tried not to, but some of it still got through.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Making yourself a sandwich?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad did.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hope he didn't use the mayonnaise, I meant to throw it out.

speaker: Frasier
text: I've seen him eat worse.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll say.  Remember when he dropped his hot dog at the petting zoo?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, I'm so sorry I said those things about you! I didn't mean them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I know, Daphne.  Come here.

speaker: Daphne
text: I guess this all finally came crashing down on me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know. It's perfectly understandable.  Listen, I know you can't go out on your date with Niles tonight, but what's to stop two friends from going out to dinner?  My treat, you can even wear that new dress of yours.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.  That's a lovely offer, but I, I think I'll just stay home tonight, have a quiet night.

speaker: Frasier
text: I understand.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.  _They exit.  Reset to: the living room as they come out._

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure you won't change your mind?

speaker: Daphne
text: Positive.

speaker: Simon
text: Hello, all.  My furry friend and I have just concluded our daily constitutional, with young Edward here dropping a few amendments along the way.  So what's on the docket tonight, eh?

speaker: Daphne
text: All I want is a quiet night at home.

speaker: Simon
text: [_lying on the couch_] Oh, Stilts, you and I are of one mind. I'll hoist a beer while you get dinner started, and then when our bellies are full and you've done the dishes, we will adjourn to the Winnebago where Mr. Jean Claude van Damme, the "Muscles from Brussels", will ply his trade against the forces of evil.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ready at eight?

speaker: Daphne
text: Make it seven-thirty. _Frasier leaves.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Martin and Niles are leaving the apartment to the hallway._

speaker: Niles
text: Good idea, Dad.  An evening out, just the two of us.  I had no idea you enjoyed the Natural History Museum.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure.  And that documentary on the rain forest is supposed to be great.

speaker: Niles
text: That's what I hear.

speaker: Martin
text: Hope it has pygmies, I like pygmies.

speaker: Niles
text: I know you do.  So, where's um...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, she went out with Frasier to a restaurant for dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  She happen to ask about...?

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry.  _The elevator arrives and they get in.  Reset to: the interior of the elevator. Martin pushes a button and they start moving._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, we're going up.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, oh, I'm sorry.  Well, we'll just have to take the long way.

speaker: Niles
text: Why do you like pygmies so much?

speaker: Martin
text: They're short and they blow darts.  What's not to like?  _CUT TO: the roof of the Elliot Bay Towers. Martin comes out the access door._

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, come on up here.

speaker: Niles
text: What could possibly be so important for me to see up here?

speaker: Martin
text: The guy in 1708 got some homing pigeons.  He built a coop up here for them.

speaker: Niles
text: [_coming up_] Pigeons?  I don't like pigeons, they have no respect for public art.

speaker: Martin
text: Trust me, you're gonna like this.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I don't think I handled things very well today.  Do you think Daphne will ever forgive me?

speaker: Martin
text: Why don't you ask her for yourself? _Niles leans past the door to see Daphne.  She is sitting at a table set up for a dinner.  There are candles all around.  Frasier pours the champagne, then starts some music._

speaker: Frasier
text: Your table is ready, sir.

speaker: Niles
text: You look stunning.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.  You look dashing.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_holding a chair for Niles to sit_] I trust this will be to your liking?

speaker: Niles
text: Everything is to my liking.

speaker: Daphne
text: Looks like we're having that first date after all.

speaker: Niles
text: You went to so much trouble!

speaker: Daphne
text: It wasn't me, it was your brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know me, I hate to butt in.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh...

speaker: Frasier
text: I had planned to take Daphne to dinner, when suddenly inspiration struck.  Since you two couldn't go to Au Pied du Cochon this evening, my faithful companion [_Martin bows._] and I would bring it to you courtesy of their caterer.  If dancing at the Starlight Room was impossible, we'd give you the real thing.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's all so overwhelming.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Dad, I don't know what to say.  You even got that man to move his pigeons.

speaker: Martin
text: There were no pigeons.

speaker: Niles
text: Ohhh...

speaker: Daphne
text: How can we ever thank you two?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just have a beautiful evening.

speaker: Niles
text: I think we can do that.  And Frasier, listen...

speaker: Frasier
text: Apology accepted, Niles.  Oh, just remember to give the lingonberry sauce a little stir...

speaker: Martin
text: They can figure it out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, about today...

speaker: Daphne
text: Let's just forget about that.  Why don't we start from here?

speaker: Niles
text: I would love that.  To us!

speaker: Daphne
text: To us.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm usually so nervous on a first date.  But not tonight.

speaker: Niles
text: Would you like to dance?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'd love to. _They get up and start dancing.  Slowly the camera rises from the room and backdrops them against the Seattle night._

speaker: Niles
text: So where you from?

speaker: Daphne
text: Manchester, England.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, my.  Big family?

speaker: Daphne
text: Hideously.  And you?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm from a small mountain village in Tibet.

speaker: Niles
text: Tenzing Norgay used to carry me to school.

speaker: Niles
text: You know what I've always wondered?

speaker: Daphne
text: I think I can guess.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah...
